you might consider just vim or emacs for all you editing needs, and copy files manually
Sanne: nvu is only for html - actually it support the ftp-thingy....

if you're going to do development with GNU tools, do yourself the favor and spend an hour doing the VIM and Emacs tutorials. Those editors are really good, but take some getting used to. Syntax highlighting and code-indentation etc. is at least as good as in any other language specific IDEs

Sanne: ill look at emacs tomorrow.. btw. quanta doesnt have the ftp-support at all
